intro: Krenakia triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and a distinctive, three-angled stem that gives it its common name. This plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores, which are dispersed by wind. Krenakia triquetra plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
